intro: Fagelia sibthorpioides, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
